intro: Colubrina glandulosa var. glandulosa, commonly known as the showy colubrina, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a versatile choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features make it an important species for pollinators and ecological restoration projects.
